data.title: Performing Arts Center
data.text:
Group Rates

A 10% discount is available to groups of 10 or more for most events. Call the Box Office for details - (702) 651-5483.

No Exchanges - No Refunds

Only Theatre Season Subscribers may exchange tickets with at least 48 hours notice.

Children

Student prices for children (18 and under) are available for select performances. Babes in arms, and children under six, are not permitted for CSN-sponsored events. However, all children attending Performing Arts Center events must be able to sit quietly regardless of age, and everyone must have a ticket.

In accordance with Nevada System of Higher Education (NSHE) Board of Regents Child Protection Policies, Title 4, Chapter 22: NSHE reserves the right to determine whether selected events and venues are appropriate. The CSN Performing Arts Center Policy, in accordance with the NSHE policy, requires children under the age of 18 years to have adult supervision, or have valid CSN student ID.

Late Seating Policy

CSN Performing Arts Center will start all events promptly at the time indicated on your ticket.

Latecomers will not be seated until a suitable pause in the performance, and at the discretion of the House Manager.

Patron Information

Please turn off any watches, pagers and cell phones.

No food or beverages allowed in the theatre.

Cameras and recording equipment are strictly prohibited.

No smoking in the theatre or the lobby.

Restrooms and drinking fountains are located near the theatre.

Patrons with Special Needs

A hearing-impaired system is available in the Nicholas Horn Theatre; a headset may be picked up at the box office upon request.

Requests for sign language interpreters can be arranged for most performances with two (2) weeks advance notice. Wheelchair seating is available in designated areas, please make your request when ordering tickets or making your reservations.

Parking is Free!

Free parking and 24-hour security are provided on campus for all events.

Renting the Performing Arts Center

Are you looking for an affordable place for your next event?

Why not come to the best and most affordable theatre in town? The CSN Performing Arts Center has been serving the Performing Arts Department and campus organizations of the college, as well as the community, since 1995.

The Center is available for rental to touring groups and professional and non-profit organizations for a variety of productions, lectures and conferences. Over 700 events take place in the center each year, including dance and music concerts, plays, pageants, recitals, meetings and seminars. Our professional staff is always available to help make your next event a successful one.

The CSN Performing Arts Center is comprised of two venues â€” the Nicholas J. Horn Theatre and the BackStage Theatre.

The Nicholas J. Horn Theatre is the perfect venue for concerts, plays, recitals and many other events. It is a 524-seat proscenium theatre and includes a complete rigging system and an ample, flexible stage area. It has been touted as the "best acoustical theatre" in town, and it features state-of-the-art equipment and technical services.

The BackStage Theatre is a 100-seat theatre space, featuring a flat-floor stage area with flexible seating that can accommodate various configurations.

Lobby

The main lobby contains two sections that easily accommodate displays and tables. Food may be served in the lobby. The area contains limited bench seating, as well as restrooms, drinking fountains and a vending machine area. The PAC Management Office is located in the lobby.

Box Office/Tickets

The box office is available to outside users who pay for the box office staff. Tickets for your event in either theatre can be pre-printed for a nominal fee, even if you choose not to rent the box office.

Dressing Rooms

Two separate rooms have 14 make-up mirrors and include sinks, restrooms and showers.

Equity Dressing Rooms

The two equity rooms each contain one make-up mirror, sofa, restroom and shower.

Green Room

The Green Room is located off stage left.

Child Protection

The NSHE and College Child Protection Policies must be reviewed and implemented by all renters who use the facility for a program/activity for children, or if under their direction, children are brought to the facility to watch a performance.

Parking is Free!

Free, convenient parking and 24-hour security are provided on campus for all events.

PAC Facilities Reservation Requests

Email the PAC Manager, Lew Haslam to make reservation requests at: Contact Us

Please include the following details: Production Company Info, Type of Performance (Dance, Play, Concert, etc.) and the dates requested.
